definition: to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: The garbage collection pause times are the most significant delays any threads encounter.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾收集停顿时间是任何线程遇到的最显著的延迟。

sentences.english: When the music paused she went towards the couple.
sentences.chinese: 当音乐停顿的时候，她走了过去。

sentences.english: This makes you pause for a minute and think.
sentences.chinese: 这让你停顿了一下，并引发了你的思考。

sentences.english: Yet this latest pause in Pakistan’s political turmoil is likely to be brief.
sentences.chinese: 然而在巴政治混乱中这次最新的停顿被看作是短暂的。

sentences.english: Semi-colons show a pause which is longer than a comma, but not as long as a full stop.
sentences.chinese: 分号表达的是一个比逗号长句号短的停顿。

sentences.english: At last Zosimus came to a halt .
sentences.chinese: 在去年卓西姆来停顿下来。

sentences.english: There have been no six-party talks with North Korea since 2009.
sentences.chinese: 六方会谈自2009年以来一直陷于停顿。

sentences.english: This gives me some starting and stopping leeway.
sentences.chinese: 这会给我一些开始和停顿的时间余地。

sentences.english: The war brought all foreign trade to a standstill .
sentences.chinese: 战争使所有的对外贸易停顿下来了。

sentences.english: The pause plays another important role when used just before the punchline.
sentences.chinese: 在笑点之前使用停顿还有作用。

sentences.english: To follow, without hait, only one aim! That's the secret of success.
sentences.chinese: 不停顿的向目标前进，这就是成功的秘诀。

sentences.english: When you pause in conversation, you do so because you have completed a thought.
sentences.chinese: 谈话中停顿下来，是因为你已经把事情说完了。

sentences.english: He made a long pause, plainly overcome by the thought.
sentences.chinese: 他停顿了很长时间，显然陷入了沉思。

sentences.english: He made a natural pause and then went on reading.
sentences.chinese: 他自然停顿了一下然后继续念下去。

sentences.english: This effect would be absent if the sley dwelt during the period of shuttle flight.
sentences.chinese: 如果梭子飞行期间筘座停顿，这种效果便不复存在了。

definition: to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank/(coll.) unexpectedly/rash/rashly
